title: ğŸ“œ Curriculum Vitae
text: Download CV â€ƒ Latest update: August 2025

title: Haiyang Gao
text:
I am a final-year undergraduate student at the Hongyi Honor College, Wuhan University, majoring in Mathematical Finance. In the 2024â€“2025 academic year, I studied Sports Management and Business Analytics under the supervision of Dr.Â Lorena Martin at the University of Southern California. In the summer of 2025, I attended the Yale Summer Session, where I took courses in Game Theory and Data Science.
My academic training has given me a broad foundation in microeconomics, macroeconomics, econometrics, behavioral economics, game theory, market equilibrium theory, statistics, stochastic analysis, numerical analysis, and data science. I am particularly interested in leveraging data science techniques â€” including machine learning and natural language processing â€” together with financial theory to rigorously investigate the degree of market rationality in China, a topic I believe is underexplored but of great importance for improving the market environment. In addition, inspired by Dr.Â Martinâ€™s course and my own passion for badminton, I aim to conduct interdisciplinary research at the intersection of data science and sports, with a focus on injury prevention, career longevity, and competition scheduling optimization in professional badminton. My long-term goal is to provide evidence-based recommendations for organizations such as the Badminton World Federation (BWF) to balance athlete health with audience engagement.
I have served as a teaching assistant for a Game Theory course (2024â€“2025), published the 2024 Annual Report on Chinaâ€™s Green Credit Market in Modern Commercial Bank (2025), and participated in seminar discussions on industrial organization theory in Professor Bo Shenâ€™s research group.

Key topics

Mathematical Finance
Data Science
Sports Management



Education
